Title: Object: He took the Young Child & his Mother & Departed into Egypt
Description: The Flight into Egypt; the Virgin carrying the sleeping infant Jesus swaddled in her cloak, with St Joseph walking beside her, carrying a staff and leading a donkey, gesturing to left towards a pool of water; rock landscape in the background; after Carle van Loo. Mezzotint
Curator's comments: States [recorded in the Lennox-Boyd database] (i) lettered at the base of the image in a plaque of light ground, with the title and 'Matthew Chap. 2d. Verse 14th // Carolus Vanlo Pinx.t // I. Iohnson fecit'. (ii) reworked; republished by Robert Sayer; publication line and number added in a clear strip to right: 'Printed for Rob.t Sayer, at the Golden Buck in Fleet Street // 537'.
Bibliographic references: Chaloner Smith 1883 / British Mezzotinto portraits from the introduction of the art to the early part of the present century (undescribed)
Russell 1926 / English Mezzotint Portraits and their states: Catalogue of Corrections of and Additions to Chaloner Smith's "British Mezzotinto Portraits" (undescribed)
